Class Geometry.Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Geometry.Triangle
  • Enclosing class:
    Geometry

    public static class Geometry.Triangle
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to contain three points of a triangle. Provides manipulations for triangle, such as collision detection.
    Author:
    Patrick Thomas

    • Method Detail

      • contains_point

        public boolean contains_point(Geometry.Point p)
        Tests to see if a point is inside of this triangle. Method inspired from http://math.stackexchange.com/questions/51326/ determining-if-an-arbitrary-point-lies-inside-a-triangle-defined-by-three-points "This is a fairly well known algorithm. It all comes down to using the cross product. Define the vectors AB, BC and CA and the vectors AP, BP and CP. Then P is inside the triangle formed by A, B and C if and only if all of the cross products AB×AP, BC×BP, and CA×CP point in the same direction relative to the plane. That is, either all of them point out of the plane, or all of them point into the plane."
        Parameters:
        p - Point
        Returns:
        boolean true if colliding, false if not
